item.title: Muslims= terrorists?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Enjoy me now, post:214, topic:151497”]no no no not like that if it was 22% or higher the atmosphere would be on fire!!! becasue of too much pure oxygen!!

21% the oxygen would be pure enough[/quote]

How fragile do you think our world is? 2.5 billion years back, when cyanobacteria ruled the roost, oxygen levels were way higher than 21%. It was known as the oxygen catastrophe, and believe me, the earth did not catch fire.

[quote=“Enjoy me now, post:214, topic:151497”]maybe but its not possible because its been proven that the universe doesnt have our sun size

if the sun was smaller we be frozen and if it was bigger we would be frying[/quote]

Actually our sun is an average sized star in the main sequence, it’s really nothing special. There are hundreds of billions of stars in a galaxy, and over a hundred billion galaxies in the universe. 90% of stars are main sequence stars. Do you really think the sun is all that special?

Read full topic

item.title: Muslims= terrorists?
item.dc:creator: @Enjoy_me_now Enjoy me now
item.description:
@Enjoy_me_now wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:213, topic:151497”][quote author=Enjoy me now link=topic=207214.msg1855143#msg1855143 date=1193718659]
oh, but hows that possible? 21% oxygen in our atmosphere, 22% we are dead 20% we dead,
any farther than the sun we dead and closer we dead, our body is 99.99% perfect hows that possible?
[/quote]

The range isn’t that small first of all; it really goes from 15% or so to 23%. Second, that is only because human bodies are adapted to 21%, not the fact that we happened to breathe that percentage by chance. If oxygen took up 25% of the atmosphere, we would undoubtedly adapt to be able to breathe 25% oxygen, no problem.[/quote]

no no no not like that if it was 22% or higher the atmosphere would be on fire!!! becasue of too much pure oxygen!!

21% the oxygen would be pure enough

[quote=“dragonus18, post:212, topic:151497”][quote author=Enjoy me now link=topic=207214.msg1855143#msg1855143 date=1193718659]
oh, but hows that possible? 21% oxygen in our atmosphere, 22% we are dead 20% we dead,
any farther than the sun we dead and closer we dead, our body is 99.99% perfect hows that possible?
[/quote]
coincidence, and if it happened to us, then the chances of there being other galaxies and planets out there like ours are just higher.[/quote]

maybe but its not possible because its been proven that the universe doesnt have our sun size

if the sun was smaller we be frozen and if it was bigger we would be frying

Read full topic

item.title: Muslims= terrorists?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Enjoy me now, post:211, topic:151497”]oh, but hows that possible? 21% oxygen in our atmosphere, 22% we are dead 20% we dead,
any farther than the sun we dead and closer we dead, our body is 99.99% perfect hows that possible?[/quote]

The range isn’t that small first of all; it really goes from 15% or so to 23%. Second, that is only because human bodies are adapted to 21%, not the fact that we happened to breathe that percentage by chance. If oxygen took up 25% of the atmosphere, we would undoubtedly adapt to be able to breathe 25% oxygen, no problem.

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:206, topic:151497”][quote author=Enjoy me now link=topic=207214.msg1855070#msg1855070 date=1193717296]
lol atheist beileve that everything came into being by itslef… how wrong that is… how can our earth be so close to the sun but not too far away??? any farther than we are now and we would be frozen, and closer we would be frying. The oxygen is carefully balenced so that and more extra oxygen we would be on fire, any less we be dead. you call that “by itself” God did it not by coisidence.
[/quote]
